weka.filters.supervised.instance
Class NumerosityReduction

java.lang.Object
  weka.filters.Filter
      weka.filters.supervised.instance.NumerosityReduction
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, weka.core.CapabilitiesHandler, weka.core.OptionHandler, weka.core.RevisionHandler, weka.filters.SupervisedFilter
public class NumerosityReduction
extends weka.filters.Filter
implements weka.filters.SupervisedFilter, weka.core.OptionHandler

Numerosity reduction, to speed up one-nearestneighbor to produce an extremely compact dataset with little or no loss in accuracy.
The original dataset must fit entirely in memory. The attributes to reduce and its percentage may be specified. The dataset must have a nominal class attribute.

Valid options are: 

 -P <num>
  The percentage of the class(es) to reduce (default 10%)
 -D <num>
  The Distance Function to use by the filter (default Euclidian Distance)
 -A <num>
  The class to reduce (default all)

  (default 0)

Author:
César Soto (csoto@uclv.edu.cu)
See Also:

public void setClassesIndicesToReduce(java.lang.String rangeList)
Sets which attributes are to be Discretized (only numeric attributes among the selection will be Discretized).
